page.title: 17HOUSES IN MILVERTON
page.content:
ON WEDNESDAY, 10TH JULY, WE WENT TO LOOK AT HOUSES IN MILVERTON. IN FORE STREET THE HOUSES ARE OLD. SOME ARE MADE OF SANDSTONE. SOME ARE COVERED IN PEBBLE DASH AND PAINTED DIFFERENT COLOURS. THE HOUSES HAVE MOSTLY GOT TWO STOREYS, SOME HAVE GOT THREE. THERE IS NO ROOM FOR THEM TO HAVE A FRONT GARDEN, BUT THEY HAVE POTS AND PLANTS GROWING UP THEM. SOME OF THE HOUSES ARE VERY PRETTY.
THEN WE WENT TO CREEDWELL ORCHARD. THE BUILDINGS THERE ARE ALL NEW FLATS AND BUNGALOWS. THEY ARE MADE OF RED AND ORANGE BRICKS. THE ROOF TILES ARE CORRUGATED AND HAVE ORANGE LICHEN GROWING ON THEM. THE GROUND FLOOR FLATS AND THE BUNGALOWS HAVE LITTLE GARDENS AROUND THEM. ON OUR WALK WE NOTICED THAT ONLY FOUR HOUSES DID NOT HAVE TELEVISION AERIALS.
